Article Title: NBA Trade Rumor: Los Angeles Lakers eye blockbuster 3-way trade for $151 million star trio after shocking Anthony Davis move
Article Text:
LeBron James and Anthony Davis (Image via NBA)

Los Angeles Lakers

Dallas Mavericks guard Luka Doncic drives against Los Angeles Lakers forward Anthony Davis (3) during the first half of an NBA basketball game in Dallas, Tuesday, Dec. 12, 2023. (Image via AP Photo/LM Otero, File)

Theare reportedly setting their sights on three key targets to strengthen their frontcourt following the shocking trade of Anthony Davis to the Dallas Mavericks. According to ClutchPoints’ Brett Siegel, the Lakers have expressed interest in Myles Turner of the Indiana Pacers, Walker Kessler of the Utah Jazz, and Nic Claxton of the Brooklyn Nets.With Davis now in Dallas, the Los Angeles Lakers find themselves without a true starting center. The urgency to add size and defensive presence has placed a significant emphasis on securing one of these three big men. However, acquiring any of them will come at a steep price, making it a challenge for Los Angeles to strike a deal.Among the three, Myles Turner has been the most talked-about option. The 28-year-old center has been a crucial part of Indiana’s recent success, and the Pacers have shown little willingness to move him. Given their strong performance in recent weeks, it is unlikely that the Los Angeles Lakers can meet Indiana’s demands in a trade.Walker Kessler, meanwhile, has been linked to Los Angeles multiple times this season. At just 23 years old, he has been a standout for the Jazz, who reportedly have a high asking price for him. This could pose a problem for the Lakers, as they may not have the necessary assets to convince Utah to part ways with their promising young center.Nic Claxton is another intriguing option, but the Brooklyn Nets ’ rebuilding situation complicates matters. At 25, he has been having a strong season, making him a valuable piece for Brooklyn. The Nets are expected to demand significant draft capital in any trade, something the Los Angeles Lakers currently lack.One of the biggest obstacles for Los Angeles is their limited trade assets. While all three centers would be strong additions to a lineup featuring LeBron James and Luka Doncic, making a deal work financially and strategically is proving to be difficult. The Los Angeles Lakers would likely need to part ways with players like Dalton Knecht or Austin Reaves to make a competitive offer. However, both have been considered untouchable in trade discussions, further complicating negotiations.Also read: NBA Trade Rumor: Los Angeles Lakers eyeing $76.5 million Boston Celtics star after blockbuster trade for Luka Doncic The Lakers will have to choose between making a big trade or finding another way to deal with their frontcourt issues as the trade deadline draws near. To be competitive in the Western Conference, they could need to look at other options if they are unable to sign Myles Turner, Walker Kessler, or Nic Claxton.
Article Summary: The Los Angeles Lakers have expressed interest in Myles Turner, Walker Kessler, and Nic Claxton. The Lakers are looking to strengthen their frontcourt following the trade of Anthony Davis to the Dallas Mavericks. However, acquiring any of them will come at a steep price, making it a challenge for Los Angeles to strike a deal.

Article Title: Princess Diana: Prince Harry reveals contacting late mother Princess Diana through psychic in his memoir 'Spare'
Article Text:
File photo: Princess Diana with young William and Harry (Picture credit: X)

Prince Harry has shared a personal story about contacting his late mother, Princess Diana, through a psychic. In his memoir, Spare, the Duke of Sussex talks about reaching out to a medium with supernatural abilities to communicate with Diana, who passed away in a car accident in Paris in 1997, just before his 13th birthday, The Mirror reported.The Duke received a message from his mother through the psychic, who told him, "You're living the life she wanted for you." Harry, now 40, says that the medium also told him his mother was with him "right now," which made his neck warm and his eyes fill with tears.The psychic shared that Diana knew Harry was "looking for clarity" and "feels your confusion." She added that Diana understood Harry had "so many questions" and that answers would come in time.Another anecdote involved Prince Harry’s son, Archie. The psychic reportedly described how Diana’s spirit witnessed Archie accidentally breaking a Christmas tree ornament shaped like Queen Elizabeth. When asked, Harry admitted the incident had occurred, adding that Archie had attempted to fix the ornament.The medium suggested Diana found humour in the situation, delighting in the antics of her grandson she never had the chance to meet.In Spare, Prince Harry also recounts an extraordinary encounter with a leopard during a trip to Botswana with his brother, Prince William. He interpreted the animal’s presence as a comforting sign from his late mother, suggesting that "everything will be fine." However, the experience was not without fear, as he briefly worried the leopard might attack.Harry has been candid about the psychological toll of losing Diana so young. As reported by The Mirror, he disclosed a haunting period after her death when he entertained the possibility that she had staged her demise. His anguish led him to repeatedly drive through the Paris tunnel where Diana’s life was cut short, attempting to make sense of the tragedy.
Article Summary: Prince Harry has shared a personal story about contacting his late mother, Princess Diana, through a psychic. In his memoir, Spare, the Duke of Sussex talks about reaching out to a medium with supernatural abilities to communicate with Diana. Diana passed away in a car accident in Paris in 1997, just before his 13th birthday.

Article Title: Marriage Proposal Goes Wrong After Girlfriend Eats Gold Ring Hidden in Cake
Article Text: A Chinese man's romantic proposal took an unexpected and humorous turn when his girlfriend unknowingly ate the engagement ring hidden in a cake, sparking laughter.The amusing incident was shared by a netizen surnamed Liu from Guang'an, Sichuan province, on a popular social media platform. Her post, titled "attention, all men: Never hide a proposal ring in food!" quickly gained traction, entertaining thousands.Liu recounted that after arriving home hungry one evening, she eagerly devoured a taro and meat floss cake her boyfriend had prepared. "The cake was covered with a thick layer of meat floss, so I was just chewing it until I bit into something hard. I immediately spat it out," she explained.Initially assuming it was a bad quality, Liu prepared to complain to the bakery. However, her boyfriend, noticing her confusion, examined the foreign object. After wiping it clean, he revealed, "Honey, I think this might be the ring I was going to propose to you with."Caught off guard, Liu thought he was joking but soon realised it was indeed a gold ring. In the awkward moment that followed, her boyfriend hesitantly asked, "What do we do now? Should I still kneel?" Liu, unable to contain her laughter, encouraged him to proceed with the proposal, which she accepted.Later, Liu described the event as the "most dramatic scene of the year" and advised against using food as a proposal medium. "This will be a memory we will never forget, but this proposal method is a bit risky. I hope others take our story as a caution and avoid trying it themselves," she told the Xiaoxiang Morning Herald.The video of the incident went viral, with netizens flooding the post with humorous reactions. One user joked, "The strength of her bite is no less than that of an adult cheetah." Another congratulated the couple, adding, "Especially to this bride-to-be for her strong teeth!"A third commenter playfully noted, "This must be what is called 'a couple's love can break gold!'" while another advised, "This will be something you'll laugh about even when you're old and grey! But seriously, guys, no more hiding rings in food. Imagine if it were a diamond that could easily break someone's tooth!"
Article Summary: A Chinese man's romantic proposal took an unexpected and humorous turn when his girlfriend unknowingly ate the engagement ring hidden in a cake. The amusing incident was shared by a netizen surnamed Liu from Guang'an, Sichuan province, on a popular social media platform.

Article Title: Voice assistants, virtual try-ons, and AI: Dubai’s new retail reality
Article Text:

AppsFlyer

e& UAE Ease Store

Pioneering a new era of retail

for more on Business in Dubai.

This article is contributed by Sindhu Kashyap

It is a part of a featured content series on Business in Dubai.

Disclaimer - This article has been produced by the Times Internet's Spotlight team

Dubai has been long celebrated as a global retail haven, and is now making waves in the world of artificial intelligence (AI). Known for its expansive malls and top-tier brands, the city is seamlessly blending tradition with technology to reshape how consumers shop, interact with brands, and experience retail.Behind the luxurious displays and bespoke offerings lies a layer of AI-powered innovation that’s redefining personalisation, streamlining operations, and enhancing customer satisfaction. From designing jewellery to curating personalised shopping experiences, Dubai is setting new benchmarks in the global retail landscape.In today’s retail environment, customers seek experiences that resonate on a personal level. AI has emerged as the linchpin of this transformation. Amreen Iqbal , Founder and Creative Director of Piece of You, a custom jewellery brand in Dubai, emphasises the depth of this shift: “It’s about understanding the customer deeper—what they want, how they want it, and how we can make it special and unique to each customer. AI helps us do that.”Her brand employs AI-powered tools to enable customers to design unique jewellery pieces through virtual try-ons and bespoke customisation. “The ability to personalise jewellery at this level was unthinkable a few years ago. Now, with AI, it’s a reality,” she adds.Similarly, global e-commerce innovations have gained traction in Dubai. Sue Azari , an e-commerce consultant at, notes, “AI enables highly customised and intuitive customer experiences.”She cites Zalando’s AI-powered chatbot as a perfect example: “If you need an outfit for a Christmas party, you simply describe your needs, and the chatbot curates a complete look, including accessories. It’s like having a personal shopper who knows your wardrobe.”In the beauty sector, major players like Sephora are redefining the customer journey with AI. Through augmented reality (AR) and AI features, their app enables users to virtually try on products like lipstick shades while integrating seamless social sharing options. Azari explains, “It’s about creating an experience, not just a transaction.”Walid BenOthman, Managing Director at Bitpanda, in Dubai, added that AI-driven personalisation has created a 25% improvement in customer satisfaction, revenue, or cost reduction. “Additionally, AI-powered chatbots and virtual assistants provide 24/7 customer support, improving engagement and customer satisfaction.”He explained AI has made it easy to bring in hyper-personalised advertisements by analysing customer behaviour, creating more effective campaigns and higher conversion rates.Adding to Dubai’s retail innovation is the launch of theat Dubai Mall, as reported. The AI-powered store enhances the telecom retail experience by offering an array of cutting-edge features. Using AI and robotics, customers can explore products, make payments, and even collect purchases from automated lockers.The store is equipped with advanced facial recognition technology, enabling personalised interactions and tailored product suggestions. It epitomises Dubai’s vision to merge physical retail with AI-driven efficiency. As highlighted in several news reports, this initiative underscores Dubai’s commitment to revolutionising traditional retail through technology. report by GoGlobe has highlighted that Dubai AI’s impact extends beyond personalisation, revolutionising how brands market their products. Generative AI (genAI) has emerged as a game-changer, enabling dynamic, hyper-personalised advertisements and streamlining content creation.“AI doesn’t just generate content; it analyses performance metrics to refine strategies in real-time. It saves marketers countless hours and ensures campaigns are efficient and impactful,” explains Azari.Iqbal highlights AI’s ability to enhance marketing precision through predictive analytics, helping businesses target audiences with unparalleled accuracy. From creating dynamic ads to optimising email campaigns, AI ensures that every touchpoint is relevant and impactful.At Amazon, for instance, AI-generated product descriptions have not only increased efficiency but also improved SEO performance and consistency. “This is not just automation; it’s about making marketing smarter and more strategic,” notes Azari.While customers benefit from AI-driven personalisation, its operational applications are equally transformative. Gavin Jackson, Senior Vice President of Data and AI at Endava, highlights the role of AI in inventory management: “AI has turned inventory management into a science. Retailers can now accurately predict demand, ensuring shelves are stocked without over-ordering. It’s a win for both businesses and consumers.”Jackson explains that AI-powered systems can even trigger additional production when products start selling out, ensuring businesses never miss a sales opportunity. Logistics and supply chains are also undergoing an AI-driven revolution, with systems optimising delivery routes, warehouse layouts, and energy consumption. “It’s about creating an interconnected ecosystem where every touchpoint is as efficient as possible,” he adds.Dubai’s embrace of AI is propelling the city into a new era of retail excellence. By integrating advanced technologies across personalisation, marketing, and operations, the city is not only enhancing customer experiences but also setting a global standard for innovation in retail.As Iqbal aptly puts it, “The ability to create personalised, meaningful experiences isn’t just a luxury—it’s a necessity. And AI makes it possible.”Dubai’s commitment to leveraging AI ensures that its reputation as a global retail hub remains stronger than ever, firmly rooted in innovation and customer-centricity.
Article Summary: Dubai is blending tradition with technology to reshape how consumers shop, interact with brands, and experience retail. From designing jewellery to curating personalised shopping experiences, Dubai is setting new benchmarks in the global retail landscape. Generative AI has emerged as a game-changer, enabling dynamic, hyper-personalised advertisements.

Article Title: Beware of ITR refund scam! You may lose lakhs with new income tax refund fraud
Article Text:

Beware of Income Tax Refund scams! The Income Tax Department has issued a warning to taxpayers, urging them to exercise caution against fraudulent refund schemes. The department has advised individuals to remain alert and vigilant against deceptive calls and pop-up notifications claiming they are eligible for a tax refund.To avoid falling victim to such scams, taxpayers are recommended to verify any communication from the I-T department through official channels. It is crucial not to respond to emails or visit websites that request sensitive information such as credit card numbers or bank account details."You have been approved an Income Tax Refund of Rs, 15000/-, the amount will be credited to your account shortly, Please verify your account number 5XXXXX6777. If this is not correct, please update your bank account information by visiting the link."According to an ET report, in a separate post, the I-T department shared an incident where an individual lost Rs 1.5 lakh after clicking on a fake refund message. The victim was directed to a fraudulent app, which resulted in his phone being hacked and money being debited from his account.Also Read | ITR refund status for FY 2023-24: How to check income tax refund status online The Income Tax Department has issued an advisory regarding potential fraudulent emails claiming to be from authorized representatives or directing individuals to supposed Income Tax websites. It is crucial to exercise caution and follow these guidelines to protect yourself from falling victim to such scams.if you receive a suspicious email - Do not reply! Engaging with the sender may lead to further complications.don’t open any attachments. Attachments may contain malicious code that will infect your computer. These attachments can harm your device and compromise your security.don’t click on any links. If you have mistakenly clicked on links in a suspicious e-mail or phishing website then do not enter confidential information like bank account, credit card details. Clicking on these links may redirect you to fraudulent websites designed to steal your sensitive information.avoid copying and pasting the link from the message into your browser. Phishers can make links look legitimate, but they may actually redirect you to different websites.Install and regularly update anti-virus software, anti-spyware programs, and a firewall. Article Title: Raising Financially Savvy Kids: Age-Appropriate Money Management Education for the Next Generation
Article Text:

Start Early with a Modest Allowance: Consider providing your children with a small monthly allowance that introduces them to the concept of budgeting and the value of earning money through contributing to household chores. By linking their efforts to tangible rewards, such as completing chores to play video games, the habit of budgeting gets cultivated and seamlessly transitions into saving real money. Teach Budgeting Using the 50:30:20 Rule: This is a simple yet powerful tool that teaches them to allocate 50% of their money for needs, like food and clothing, 30% for wants, such as toys or treats, and 20% for savings . This approach helps children discern between needs and wants while cultivating patience in their financial journey. Make Learning Fun with Board Games: Incorporate board games like Monopoly, Game of Life, etc., into family game nights. These games not only entertain but also impart valuable lessons on financial planning, decision-making, and the significance of saving and investing. Explore Age-Appropriate Books: Invest in age-appropriate books that emphasize the importance of saving and financial responsibility, from colorful stories for younger audiences to more sophisticated guides for older children. Encourage Smart Shopping : Take children along when shopping and show them how to compare prices. Teach them to look for good deals and bargains, instilling resourcefulness and a strong sense of stewardship.

If the world is a giant machine, money is the fuel that keeps it running smoothly. From buying groceries to raising funds, money is at the heart of almost everything we do. That's why understanding how money works is so crucial in today's world.However, in the schoolyard of life, the curriculum often skips over the ABCs of financial literacy .Hence, it becomes imperative for parents to step into the role of headmasters, ensuring their children are equipped with more than just algebra and history. Just as parents meticulously prepare their children for exams and extracurricular activities, they must also take the reins in imparting essential lessons on money management . When one knows how to budget, save, and spend wisely, one is better prepared to handle everyday situations like paying bills, or even planning for big goals like college or a career.Financial literacy isn't just about balancing a checkbook or understanding compound interest; it's about fostering a mindset of prudence, responsibility, and foresight. From an early age, children absorb lessons about money, whether consciously or unconsciously, from their surroundings. Therefore, it's incumbent upon parents, educators, and policymakers to ensure that these lessons are deliberate and conducive to financial well-being. Just as we teach children the alphabet before they can read, we should introduce basic financial concepts before they encounter their first paycheck.Here are practical steps that parents can incorporate into their child-rearing journey to ensure a lifetime of sound financial habits:By instilling financial literacy in children today, we are sowing the seeds for a future where they will grow into financially confident adults, capable of making informed decisions, pursuing their dreams, and contributing meaningfully to society. As these empowered individuals enter the workforce and engage in economic activities, they will not only secure their financial well-being but cultivate a stronger, more resilient economy for generations to come.

Key components of hallmark on gold jewellery



Gold, silver hallmarking : Gold and silver jewllery have long been treasured for their beauty and value. However, ensuring their purity and authenticity is important, especially in a market prone to fraudulent practices. This is where the hallmarking scheme comes into play. Here’s what you need to know about hallmarking charges and its procedures:Hallmarking is the process of accurately determining and officially recording the proportionate content of precious metals in articles, such as gold and silver.It serves as a guarantee of their purity or fineness. In India, hallmarking is governed by stringent standards outlined in IS 15820, according to an ET report.Hallmarking charges are applied per article, regardless of its weight. For gold articles, the charge is Rs 45 per article, with a minimum charge of Rs 200 for a consignment. Similarly, for silver articles, the charge is Rs 35 per article, with a minimum charge of Rs 150 for a consignment. It's important to note that additional taxes and levies may apply.A consignment refers to a collection of articles with the same fineness, from which a sample is drawn and assayed for compliance. Different lots may exist within a consignment.Anyone can have their hallmarked jewellery tested for purity at an A&H centre by paying a testing fee of Rs. 200 (for testing using the fire assay method as per IS 1418). These centres must be recognized by the BIS. The list of recognized A&H centres is available on the BIS website under the hallmarking section.The primary objective of hallmarking is to safeguard consumers from counterfeit products. To achieve this, the Indian government made hallmarking mandatory for gold jewellery from June 16, 2021. Since April 1, 2023, jewellers are prohibited from selling any gold jewellery without a 6-digit Hallmark Unique Identification ( HUID ) number.If you bought gold jewellery on or before June 30, 2021, it may have old hallmarking signs. These signs include the purity/fineness mark and the BIS emblem, along with two additional indications: the jeweller's identification number and the assay centre's mark/number.However, starting July 1, 2021, these two indications were replaced with a unique alphanumeric HUID code. The hallmark remains valid for the lifetime of the jewellery, and consumers can sell old jewellery, whether hallmarked or un-hallmarked, to jewellers.The HUID, or hallmark Unique Identification number, is a key component of hallmarking in gold jewellery. It's a unique six-digit alphanumeric code assigned to each hallmarked item, allowing for traceability. Customers can verify the HUID number using the 'Verify HUID' feature in the BIS Care App.Since the introduction of the HUID on July 1, 2021, the hallmark on gold jewellery consists of three marks: the BIS logo, the purity of the article in caratage and fineness, and a unique six-digit alphanumeric HUID number.
Article Summary: Hallmarking is the process of accurately determining and officially recording the proportionate content of precious metals in articles, such as gold and silver. In India, hallmarking is governed by stringent standards outlined in IS 15820. Since April 1, 2023, jewellers are prohibited from selling any gold jewellery without a 6-digit Hallmark Unique Identification number.

What are NYT Strands and how to play the game?

Strands is a puzzle game that blends elements of Connections, Spelling Bee, and classic crossword puzzles. Players are given 48 letters arranged on a 6 x 8-inch grid, along with a daily theme. The goal is to solve the Spangram and uncover all the theme-related words.

To play, connect letters on the grid to form words by dragging your mouse or fingers (on a touchscreen) in horizontal, vertical, or diagonal directions.

Start by identifying the central theme word or Spangram, which will help you understand the puzzle’s theme.

In addition to the Spangram, you must also find other words related to the theme hidden in the grid. Once you’ve uncovered them all, the puzzle is complete.

Tips for solving NYT Strands puzzle

Identify the theme words: Fill in the grid with the theme words. Once found, they will be highlighted in blue and won't overlap with each other.

Find the Spangram: Identify the Spangram, a key part of the puzzle that connects two opposite sides of the grid. It encapsulates the theme and may consist of two words. The Spangram will be highlighted in yellow once you’ve located it.

Take advantage of hints: Pay attention to off-topic words for clues. For every three non-theme words you uncover, letters will be highlighted to give you a hint toward finding a theme word, without directly revealing it.

What is Google vs Epic Games case is all about

What Google said in its arguments

The legal battle between Google and “Fortnite” creator Epic Games takes center stage once again, as lawyers for both companies appear before a US appeals court in California. Google is seeking to overturn a jury verdict and a subsequent judge’s order asking the tech giant to change Play Store practices, as per news agency Reuters.Epic Games initiated the legal proceedings in 2020, accusing Google of monopolistic practices concerning app access on Android devices and in-app transaction processing.Following the jury’s verdict in October last year, Google was ordered to introduce competition by allowing users to download rival app stores directly from Google's Play Store. The order also required Google to make its Play Store app catalog available to these competing app stores, among other significant reforms.However, in court filings submitted to the 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in San Francisco, Google argued that legal errors committed by the trial judge unfairly benefited Epic Games in the antitrust case. The company contends that these errors led to an unjust outcome and warrant the appeals court's intervention.This order is currently on hold pending the 9th Circuit's consideration of Google's appeal.Among multiple other solutions, the tech giant maintained that its Play Store faces robust competition from Apple's App Store and that the judge erred by allowing Epic Games to present the case to jurors as if Google and Apple were not competitors in the app distribution and in-app payment space.Google's appeal also challenges the nationwide scope of Judge Donato's order, arguing that it should have only affected Epic Games specifically, not all users and developers nationwide.Meanwhile, Epic Games, in its response to the appeal, has urged the 9th Circuit to reject Google's arguments. Epic accuses Google of employing a “years-long strategy to suppress competition among app stores and payment solutions.”Reportedly, the company stated that it will “fight to ensure that the jury's verdict and the court's injunction are upheld and Google is held to account for its anticompetitive behavior.”Microsoft has filed a brief in support of Epic Games, as have the US Justice Department and the Federal Trade Commission (FTC).
Article Summary: Epic Games initiated the legal proceedings in 2020, accusing Google of monopolistic practices concerning app access on Android devices and in-app transaction processing. Google is seeking to overturn a jury verdict and a subsequent judge’s order asking the tech giant to change Play Store practices.

Article Title: All you need is AI: Beatles' “Now and Then” wins the band their eight Grammy
Article Text:
(Picture Courtesy: Facebook)

The Beatles have won their eighth Grammy Award with "Now and Then," a song completed using machine learning technology that revived a decades-old John Lennon demo. The track beat out rock bands like Green Day, Pearl Jam , and The Black Keys.The song, completed in 2021 using advanced sound isolation techniques, won Best Rock Performance at the 2024 Grammy Awards, beating out contemporary rock bands like Green Day and Pearl Jam.John Lennon's son, Sean Ono Lennon , accepted the award, praising the band as "the greatest of all time."The track originated from a lo-fi demo Lennon recorded in the late 1970s, which remained unreleased due to technical limitations preventing vocal and instrumental separation. Filmmaker Peter Jackson's sound team developed machine-learning algorithms that could precisely extract and clean Lennon's original vocals and piano, enabling Paul McCartney and Ringo Starr to finally complete the song.McCartney was quick to dispel misconceptions about artificial intelligence's role, emphasizing that no synthetic elements were created. "It's all real and we all play on it," he stated, clarifying that the AI merely helped clean up existing recordings—a technique that has been evolving for years.
Article Summary: "Now and Then" won Best Rock Performance at the 2024 Grammy Awards. The track beat out rock bands like Green Day, Pearl Jam, and The Black Keys. The song originated from a lo-fi demo Lennon recorded in the late 1970s.

Article Title: The 'Fu***ing' cheat code to get Google search results without AI summaries
Article Text:
Image credit: Pixabay

Problems faced by Google’s AI Overviews



Are you tired of Google ’s AI-generated search results? There’s a simple trick to bypass them by adding an expletive to your query. Google’s AI Overviews , which often pull unreliable information, won’t appear if a swear word is included in the search. For example, searching “How large is the student body of IIT Delhi?” generates an AI summary, but tweaking it to “How large is the f***ing student body at IIT Delhi?” removes the AI response, displaying only traditional blue links.We at TOI Tech tried exploiting this loophole which can be helpful for those who prefer unfiltered search results. Take a look at the screenshots below:However, this isn’t the first time internet users have found a way to disable Google’s AI-powered results. Other techniques exist but are more complex, such as appending specific character strings to the search URL. To compare, simply adding an expletive to the query is way easier.This loophole of adding an expletive to a search query to prevent Google from displaying an AI Overview was first spotted by Ars Technica. The report claims that this may be happening due to Google’s strict content policies, which likely train its AI model, Gemini, to avoid repeating profanity. Rather than filtering the response, Google is reportedly disabling the AI summary altogether when a curse word is present.While Google is expected to patch this loophole eventually, for now, users who prefer traditional search results have a simple trick to bypass AI summaries.Google’s AI Overviews have been under scrutiny since their launch, with viral blunders like advising users to use glue to keep cheese from sliding off pizza or eat pebbles for gut health. These responses reportedly stemmed from Reddit comments, highlighting AI’s struggle to detect sarcasm and satire.Google AI summaries may also risk amplifying misinformation by presenting flawed responses as authoritative. The issue extends beyond Google search to voice assistants like Siri now defaults to AI-generated answers using ChatGPT, sometimes delivering incorrect information instead of admitting uncertainty.Google defends AI Overviews by claiming they drive traffic to original sources and argues that users will explore linked articles after reading the summaries. However, some companies remain sceptical, with lawsuits against AI firms like OpenAI and Perplexity for allegedly scraping their content.
Article Summary: Google’s AI Overviews won’t appear if a swear word is included in the search. For example, searching “How large is the student body of IIT Delhi?” generates an AI summary. Adding an expletive to the query removes the AI response, displaying only traditional blue links.

Article Title: Google exec responds to the company’s Super Bowl ad error that experts contested with Indian Paneer and more
Article Text:
Representative Image

Wisconsin - Wisconsin Cheese Mart: Gemini in Google Docs

A major factual error in Google's Super Bowl commercial has prompted Google Cloud apps president Jerry Dischler to defend Gemini AI's accuracy, claiming the disputed information was "not a hallucination" but rather "grounded in the Web."The controversy centers on Gemini AI's claim that Gouda cheese represents "50 to 60 percent of the world's cheese consumption" - a statistic that cheese experts say is significantly inflated.The statement appeared in Google's Super Bowl campaign in the US showcasing how small businesses use Gemini AI across all fifty states.Dischler’s reply comes to a user on X (formerly Twitter), who weighed in on the ad, noting that Gemini is stating a wrong fact in the ad. “In Google's Wisconsin local Super Bowl ad, an AI hallucination is shown on screen: It says *Gouda* accounts for "50 to 60 percent of the world's cheese consumption. Gemini provides no source, but that is just unequivocally false,” reads the post. “Cheddar & mozzarella would like a word”Cornell University's E.V. Baker Professor of Agricultural Economics Emeritus, Andrew Novakovic , disputes the accuracy of this claim. "While Gouda is likely the most common single variety in world trade, it is almost assuredly not the most widely consumed," Novakovic explained to The Verge, noting that Indian Paneer and fresh cheeses from South America, Africa, and Asia likely have much larger consumption volumes globally.While the commercial includes a fine-print disclaimer stating "This is a creative writing aid, and is not intended to be factual," critics argue this raises concerns about Gemini's reliability for business applications, especially since the ad depicts a business owner using the tool to generate website content.Responding to the backlash, Dischler defended the statistic on X, citing its appearance on multiple websites, including Cheese.com - though the credibility of this source has been questioned in online discussions dating back over a decade.
Article Summary: Gemini AI claims that Gouda cheese represents "50 to 60 percent of the world's cheese consumption" This statistic has been disputed by cheese experts. Google Cloud apps president Jerry Dischler defended the statistic, saying it was "not a hallucination" but "grounded in the Web"

Article Title: Reliance Jio rolls out Rs 445 prepaid plan: Here’s what the new plan offers
Article Text:
Reliance Jio Rs 445 plan

Reliance Jio updates Rs 448 and Rs 1,748 prepaid plans

Reliance Jio has introduced a new prepaid plan for its subscribers. The Mukesh Ambani-owned telecom operator has introduced a prepaid plan of Rs 445. The plan offer unlimited calling benefits and 2GB daily data.Under the Rs 445 plan, the service provider offer unlimited calling benefit, 100 SMS per day and 2GB daily data. The plan comes with validity of 28 days. Along with this, the plan also offer free subscription to Sony LIV, ZEE5, Liongate Plat, Discovery+, Sun NXT, Kanchan Lannka, Planet Marathi, Chaupal, FanCode and Hoichoi via the JioTV app. The plan will also offer unlimited 5G data to the subscribers.Recently, Reliance Jio revised two prepaid plans after TRAI’s new rule. TRAI recently directed telecom operators to reintroduce only voice or SMS services. Mukesh Ambani-owned telecom operator has introduced two news plans of Rs 448 and Rs 1748. Both the plans offer only voice and SMS benefits. The newly introduced plan is specifically designed for customers who primarily use their phones for calls and text messages without requiring data services.The Rs 1,748 plan now offers unlimited voice calls and 3,600 SMS, with a validity of 336 days. Reliance Jio has also reduced the price of its Rs 458 plan to Rs 448. This plan continues to offer unlimited voice calls and 1,000 SMS for an 84-day period.
Article Summary: Reliance Jio has introduced a new prepaid plan of Rs 445 for its subscribers. The plan offer unlimited calling benefits and 2GB daily data. The Rs 445 plan also offers free subscription to Sony LIV, ZEE5, Liongate Plat, Discovery+, Sun NXT.
